bibl.title: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, November 7, 1952

div1.p: Nogueira proposes the Finlay award for Cooke posthumously, and notes that other individuals are being considered for the honor as well. He lists the names of persons receiving an official invitation to attend the dedication of Camp Lazear and describes Hench's role during the ceremony. Hench is to forward a copy of his speech so that it can be translated into Spanish for the Cuban media.

div1.head: Letter from Pedro Nogueira to Philip Showalter Hench, November 7, 1952
div1.opener:
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
TELEFONO: BO-7577
MARTI 219. MARIANAO
Marianao November 7 of 1952
Dr Philip Hench.
Mayo Clinic.
Rochester, Minnesota
U.S.A.
Dear Philip:
div1.p:
I just receive your letter about the death of Dr Cooke,
for which I regret very much. I want to advance that I have proposed
to the Board “Finlay Order”, to cencede him the Postum Condecoration
on the highest grade possible so that you will please send me the
address of the surviving family as well as, the name.

On the other hand please know today I put on the mail the invita-
tions for the act on December 3rd for the following persons: Colonel
Siler; General Streit; General Armstrong; Mrs Kean; General Love; Mr
and Mrs Briggs; Mr and Mrs Houston Lazear; Mrs Blossom Reed; General
and Mrs Truby; General and Mrs W. Reed; Mr Hanberry.

Yours isnt going, because it is not neccesary, as you are on the
official program to speak on that ocassion. And beside the speakers
before you, will be Board Health Minister; Dr Alberto Recio, Presi-
dent of Patronate and may be the President of Republic will give the
summary of the act.

Of course, you will have your turn before the President.- The in-
vitations with complete program will be ready inside a few days and
each one of these person about mentioned. I will send one, and to
you I will mail several, too, in case you like to give anybody that
you think deserve them but if you prefer let me know, the name and I
would be pleased to send them from here.-

Next matter Philip, has Dr Ames any family who should write?, be-
cause it is neccesary to have this date as soon as possible.

An agreeable surprise to you that the goverment authorize me to
invite Hanberry on its account to attend the acts on the 3rd and you
will see the program where he will be the person to unveil the Medals
and the plates with the volunteers names, and those you know have con-
tributed on Yellow Fever discovery. At the same time I am proposing
that Hanberry receive Finlay Order on the Highest Grade possible (may-
be Grand Officer), as he is the only surviving of that great work.- W
What do you think about it?.-

I hope to write Hanberry on Sunday informing him all this, but I
like to know you help me, to see the way, he should receive the money
on the trip to come down and stay here, of course till the 4th Decem-
ber, why at the evening on the act at the Science Academy the Presiden
of the Republic will pin on him the Condecoration (That is necessary
confirmations).-

I recommend you write him right away and his answer, you let me
know.- You can tell him in your letters that Wednesday o Thursday he
can wait my letter in South Carolina.

I have several proposal for Finlay Decoration for the persons you
pointed out, so that we must wait till the Board resolution.

I suppose the Board will meet from to 15 to 20 this month, that's
why I need the dates I ask you about Cooke and Ames, quick as possible
The Park is alright on Saturday I will meet with cameraman to take
DR. PEDRO NOGUEIRA
MEDICO CIRUJANO
MARTI 219. MARIANAO
TELEFONO: BO-7577
Philip ( Continuation)
2
some views to send you next week, you will see how the job is get-
ting on.

Today I get “Sterberg Book”, and for which I am much obliged
but I should explain Philip, I was anxious Saternberg book, subject
“Etiology and Prevention of Yellow Fever”.- I thiank was written
the last century.- I hope you will have the reference “Gorgas and
his life” as you said in your former letters.

Philip nothing more today.- I am very glad you are at home to
write you every time, there is a matter to fix, time is running
away and the date is getting near.

Philip, don't forget to send me your speech to have it transla-
te in spanish on time, for the paapers and also let me know, what
day, number trip and what line, you will come down to Cuba, to
meet you on the airport.
